thread.title: Gil Dezer shows off his amphibious WaterCar Panther

author: John Caposele
title: Gil Dezer shows off his amphibious WaterCar Panther
text:
The WaterCar Panther is billed as "the most fun vehicle on the planet." That just might be accurate, considering the auto's ability to transform from car to boat in under 15 seconds.
Source: CNBC The WaterCar Panther can go from car to boat in moments. This $180,000 glimmering silver version of the amphibious vehicle belongs to Miami real estate tycoon Gil Dezer and is featured on an upcoming episode of CNBC's "Secret Lives of the Super Rich." 
Source: CNBC On land, the Panther takes on the look of an unassuming Jeep. "My daily drive is a 911 Turbo convertible, which is a great Miami car," says Dezer. "But in traffic…sometimes you need to use alternative methods."
With his Panther, Dezer can exit the highway and drive straight into nearby Biscayne Bay, where a quick gear shift and the push of a button transforms the car into a full-fledged speedboat. In the water, it can go as fast as 45 miles per hour.
Source: CNBC "I definitely think that next time James Bond needs to escape from a villain, this is the machine," says Dezer.
Source: CNBC The Panther zooms through Biscayne Bay at top speed. And though escaping an evil villain may be no problem for the Panther, there are sometimes complications. While filming "Secret Lives of the Super Rich," the cops showed up after a concerned onlooker dialed 9-1-1 to report a car had driven into the bay.
Source: CNBC The WaterCar Panther gets up close and personal with the Miami PD Catch the season premiere of "Secret Lives of the Super Rich" Wednesday, March 7 at 10pm ET/PT on CNBC.
